examples.behavior.terminals

Class MarkFieldTerminal

  • java.lang.Object
    • gep.model.GeneElement<T>
      • gep.model.GeneTerminal<T>
        • gep.model.ChromosomeIndependentGeneTerminal<T>
          • examples.behavior.terminals.EnvironmentDependendTerminal<java.lang.Boolean>
            • examples.behavior.terminals.MarkFieldTerminal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class MarkFieldTerminal
extends EnvironmentDependendTerminal<java.lang.Boolean>
    This class represents a terminal that always returns success and places or removes a mark on its current position on the world map. The mode (place/remove) is decided on instantiation.
    Author:
    Johannes Wortmann
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • MarkFieldTerminal

        public MarkFieldTerminal(EvaluationEnvironment env,
                         boolean addMarker)
        Creates a new Terminal that handles the marking of fields. If the parameter addMarker is set to true, this terminal will add a mark on the current position of the agent in the provided environment. If addMarker is set to false, this terminal will instead remove a marker from the current position (if present), when triggered.
        Parameters:
        env - The environment in which this terminal is applied.
        addMarker - true if terminal should add markers, false if it should remove markers
